category: Human Rights Management Regulations/Article 31 (Human Rights Violation Relief Procedures)
contents: Article 31 (Procedures for relief from human rights violations) The Chairman operates the procedures for relief from human rights violations as follows. 1. The Chairman shall establish and publicize relief procedures so that human rights victims can freely file complaints while receiving guaranteed status. 2. If the human rights of athletes, sports association/related organization employees, and stakeholders affected by business activities are violated, such as discrimination against rights guaranteed by international human rights norms, including the Sports Association’s “Human Rights Management Charter,” and the Constitution and laws of the Republic of Korea, etc. You can use the complaint system to receive relief. 3. The chairman establishes an organization and deploys personnel so that the complaint system can be operated effectively. 4. The complaint system makes it easy to access and use the system by removing barriers to using the system, such as protecting the victim's identity, language barriers, costs, and fear of retaliation. 5. Detailed procedures and methods for redress for human rights violations shall be separately established and operated.
